page.title: 10FARMING 1:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: This block includes about 1160a. of Bedingham & 1350a. of Hedenham.This part of Bedingham is divided into 3 big & 1 small farms & 3 smallholdings, largely owner-occupied,but in Hedenham the majority of the land is farmed by the Earl Ferrars with Ditchingham Hall Estate,though there are 3 other owner- occupied farms or smallholdings. The higher land is mainly a strong mixed clay soil, but there are lighter soils in the valleys. The main crops are wheat,barley for malting or cattle feed,green peas for canning,an increasing acreage of oil- seed rape & decreasing acreages of sugar beet & other roots compared with the past.The arable farmers burn their straw after harvest but those with stock use it for bedding,or - after suitable treatment - for cattle feed, rather than making hay or silage.
